title: Leave Your Lover
lyrics:
In the fourth track on Sam Smithâ€™s debut album In The Lonely Hour, Sam sings of their pain in regards to a forbidden love.
[Verse 1]
I don't have much to give, but I don't care for gold
What use is money when you need someone to hold?
Don't have direction, I'm just rolling down this road
Waiting for you to bring me in from out the cold
[Pre-Chorus]
You'll never know the endless nights
The rhyming of the rain
Or how it feels to fall behind
And watch you call his name
[Chorus]
Pack up and leave everything
Don't you see what I can bring?
Can't keep this beating heart at bay
Set my midnight sorrow free
I will give you all of me
Just leave your lover, leave him for me
Leave your lover, leave him for me

We sit in bars and raise our drinks to growing old
Oh, I'm in love with you and you will never know
But if I can't have you, I'll walk this life alone
Spare you the rising storm and let the rivers flow
